item.title: Beacon
item.description:
Beacons are small devices that enable relatively accurate location within a narrow range (like indoors). Beacons periodically transmit small amounts of data within a range of approximately 70 meters, and are often used for indoor location technology. Wikipedia Research Smart Wearables Indoor Positioning, Indoor Positioning with Beacons Health: Navigation for Wheelchair Users, GuideBeacon
iBeacon by Apple and Eddystone (formerly UriBeacon) by Google are 2 popular beacon technologies.

item.title: QR Code
item.description:
QR code is a type of 2D matrix barcode with a machine-readable optical label that contains information about the item to which it is attached. A QR code consists of black squares arranged in a square grid on a white background. Wikipedia Research IoT Deployment, Smart Card, Security for QR Codes
Example The QR code system became popular due to its fast readability and greater storage capacity compared to standard UPC barcodes.

item.title: RFID
item.description:
Radio-frequency identification (RFID) uses electromagnetic fields to automatically identify and track tags, containing electronically stored information, attached to objects. There are passive and active tags. Wikipedia In 2009, Kevin Ashton, who cofounded the Auto-ID Center researching RFID, wrote an article in the RFID Journal titled “That ‘Internet of Things’ Thing”. He is attributed with having coined the IoT term then.
